{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = Edimax EW-7612UAn v2.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = 300Mbps Wireless High-Gain USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = https://www.edimax.com/edimax/merchandise/merchandise_detail/data/edimax/global/wireless_adapters_n300/ew-7612uan_v2/ |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = Edimax_EW-7612UAn_v2 |wikipedia = |brand = Edimax |model = EW-7612UAn |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v2 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = March 14, 2019 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Edimax_EW-7612UAn_v2 |sernum = |series = |wlclass = N300 |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = micro dongle (w/ large antenna) |vendor_id = 7392 |device_id = 7822 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = NDD9578221026 |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192CU; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = Yes |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/25/2011 |estreldate = |price = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B017MGU842 |asin_country = GB |asin2 = B00F9OKKIE |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== ===Review of Linux Compatibility=== [http://m.linux-hardware-guide.com/2014-04-07-edimax-ew-7612uan-wifi-usb-adapter-300mbits-802-11n Edimax EW-7612UAn] is a USB WiFi stick, which is available in two different versions, :both of them using a different chipset and hence needing different drivers. ===Version V1: 0bda:8172=== The version V1 of the EW-7612UAn bases on the Realtek RTL8191SU chipset :and has the USB ID: '''0bda:8172''' : Bus 001 Device 006: ID 0bda:8172 Realtek Semiconductor Corp. RTL8191SU 802.11n WLAN Adapter The stick is supported under Linux by the kernel module [http://linuxwireless.org/en/users/Drivers/rtl819x rtl819x]. :Alternatively, the driver provided by [http://www.edimax.com/images/Image/Driver_Utility/Wireless/NIC/EW-7612UAn/7612_22_Linux_Driver.zip Edimax for download] can be used. :However, this driver has to be compiled and installed by hand. *[https://www.wireless-driver.com/edimax-ew7612uan-wireless-windows-macos-linux-drivers-software/ EW-7612UAn] (USB \ VID_7392 & PID_7612) ===Version V2: 7392:7822=== The version V2 of the EW-7612UAn bases on the RTL8192CU (RTL8192SU ?) chipset :and has the USB ID: '''7392:7822''' : Bus 001 Device 006: ID 7392:7822 Edimax Technology Co., Ltd There is no driver integrated in the Linux standard kernel for this stick until now. :Therefore, one has to download the [http://edimax-de.eu/images/Image/products/EW-7612UAnV2/RTL8192CU_linux_v3.0.2164.20110715_EDIMAX%20EW-7612UAn%20V2.zip driver from the Edimax homepage]. The configuration and installation of the driver is explained in detail at [http://blog.unterhaltungsbox.com/ew-7612uan-v2-unter-debian/ blog]. :The following steps have to be executed in order to install the RTL8192 driver: {{SCollapse|RTL8192CU(SU) driver | 1. The RTL8192CU(SU) driver package needs to be downloaded: 
wget http://blog.unterhaltungsbox.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/RTL8192.zip
2. The tools unzip and nano are needed for the installation. These tools can be installed by apt-get install unzip nano 3. Afterwards, the downloaded archive can be unzipped: unzip RTL8192.zip 4. and the included archive can be unpacked: cd RTL8188C_8192C_8192D_USB_linux_v3.4.2_3727.20120404/driver/ tar xfvz rtl8188C_8192C_8192D_usb_linux_v3.4.2_3727.20120404.tar.gz 5. In order to change the souce code files, one should change to the following directory: cd rtl8188C_8192C_8192D_usb_linux_v3.4.2_3727.20120404/include/ 6. and has to change the file osdep_service.h nano osdep_service.h and add after the lines #include #include the following include command: #include This means, that the file should look like the following: #ifndef __OSDEP_SERVICE_H_ #define __OSDEP_SERVICE_H_ #include #include #include 7. Finally, the driver can be compiled and installed cd .. make clean make sudo make install 8. The compiled kernel module 8192cu can be loaded by modprobe 8192cu }} [[Category:English Documentation]]
